title: Oir.a.Chuain.Shiair-Facing.the.Atlantic--BBC-Alba--3Ep--468p
description:
Oir a' Chuain Shiair/Facing the Atlantic 

Documentary taking a look at the wildlife and landscape of Europe's western coast. 

Shown on Scottish Gaelic language channel BBC Alba. 
Originally shown in 2011 (I think). 

More info: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b04jlrf8 

832x468 resolution (the best I can download older shows from the BBC) 

Scottish Gaelic with English subtitles. 
____________________________________________________________________ 

Oir a' Chuain Shiair/Facing the Atlantic - Episode 1 
The programme begins in the Azores, part of Portugal, and an archipelago of nine islands pushed up from the sea by volcanic eruption in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean. From here the team travels to Spain on the Sierra Morena uplands of Andujar to find the world's rarest big cat, the lynx, before visiting Europe's largest wetland in Coto DoÃ±ana National Park, near Seville. 


Oir a' Chuain Shiair/Facing the Atlantic - Episode 2 
Tha a' phrÃ²gram a' toiseachadh tarsainn air na Pyrenees, anns an Fhraing. An uair sin, siubhlaidh sinn gu Eileanan a' Chaolais Shasannaich, far a bheil an sinn a' lorg grÃ ineag bhÃ n annasach, agus an laghairt as dathaich san Roinn-EÃ²rpa. Cuideachd, tha saoghal fon uisge a tha lÃ n de bheatha - beatha a tha comasach air sgÃ th 's uisgeachan blÃ tha Srutha a' Chamais. 
In this programme, we begin our journey over the Pyrenees to France. Next up are the Channel Islands where the team encounters an unusual blonde hedgehog and the most colourful lizard in Europe, along with a rich underwater world which has been created by the warm waters of the Gulf Stream. Then it's on to the Isles of Scilly. 


Oir a' Chuain Shiair/Facing the Atlantic - Episode 3 
Tha sinn a' gluasad gu Alba gus coimhead air aon dhe na calaidhean nÃ darra as motha san t-saoghal. Ã€ sin, tha iad a' gluasad chun nan Eileanan FÃ ro, agus tÃ¬r bholcÃ²nach Innis-tÃ¬le. Tha an turas iongantach seo a' tighinn gu crÃ¬och aig an loch as motha ann an Innis-tÃ¬le, far a bheil an t-uisge as glaine san t-saoghal, agus a tha a' toirt cothrom dha luchd-tadhail srucadh ann am mÃ²r-thÃ¬rean EÃ²rpach agus Aimearaganach, 's gun iad ach meatair o chÃ¨ile. 
In the final programme, We travel to Scotland to view one of the world's largest natural harbours before setting off to experience the striking landscape of the Faroe Islands and the volcanic terrain of Iceland. 
This incredible excursion ends at Iceland's largest lake which boasts the clearest water in the world and allows visitors the opportunity to touch both the European and American continents, just a metre apart
